trans-unit.source: Running the SimpleNetworkServerSample program

seg-source.mrk: Running the SimpleNetworkServerSample program

target.mrk: Running the SimpleNetworkServerSample program

trans-unit.source: To run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program, follow these steps.

seg-source.mrk: To run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program, follow these steps.

target.mrk: To run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server sample program, follow these steps.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt and change directories to the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo</codeph> directory, where <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%</codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Open a command prompt and change directories to the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo</codeph> directory, where <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%</codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

target.mrk: Open a command prompt and change directories to the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo</codeph> directory, where <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%</codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: Set the classpath to include the current directory (".") and the following jar files:

seg-source.mrk: Set the classpath to include the current directory (".") and the following jar files:

target.mrk: Set the classpath to include the current directory (".") and the following jar files:

trans-unit.source: <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>

trans-unit.source: The Network Server jar file. It must be in your CLASSPATH because you start the Network Server in this program.

seg-source.mrk: The Network Server jar file.
It must be in your CLASSPATH because you start the Network Server in this program.

target.mrk: The Network Server jar file.
It must be in your CLASSPATH because you start the Network Server in this program.

trans-unit.source: <codeph>derby.jar</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>derby.jar</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>derby.jar</codeph>

trans-unit.source: The database engine jar file.

seg-source.mrk: The database engine jar file.

target.mrk: The database engine jar file.

trans-unit.source: <codeph>derbytools.jar</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>derbytools.jar</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>derbytools.jar</codeph>

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools jar file.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools jar file.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools jar file.

trans-unit.source: Test the CLASSPATH settings by running the following Java command:

seg-source.mrk: Test the CLASSPATH settings by running the following Java command:

target.mrk: Test the CLASSPATH settings by running the following Java command:

trans-unit.source: java org.apache.derby.tools.sysinfo

seg-source.mrk: java org.apache.derby.tools.sysinfo

target.mrk: java org.apache.derby.tools.sysinfo

trans-unit.source: This command displays the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files that are in the classpath.

seg-source.mrk: This command displays the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files that are in the classpath.

target.mrk: This command displays the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files that are in the classpath.

trans-unit.source: After you set up your environment correctly, run the <codeph>SimpleNetworkServerSample</codeph> program from the same directory:

seg-source.mrk: After you set up your environment correctly, run the <codeph>SimpleNetworkServerSample</codeph> program from the same directory:

target.mrk: After you set up your environment correctly, run the <codeph>SimpleNetworkServerSample</codeph> program from the same directory:

trans-unit.source: java SimpleNetworkServerSample

seg-source.mrk: java SimpleNetworkServerSample

target.mrk: java SimpleNetworkServerSample

trans-unit.source: If the program runs successfully, you will receive output that is similar to that shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: If the program runs successfully, you will receive output that is similar to that shown in the following example:

target.mrk: If the program runs successfully, you will receive output that is similar to that shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: Starting Network Server Testing if Network Server is up and running! <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server now running Got an embedded connection. Testing embedded connection by executing a sample query number of rows in sys.systables = 16 While my app is busy with embedded work, ij might connect like this: $ java -Dij.user=me -Dij.password=pw -Dij.protocol= jdbc:derby:\\localhost:1527\ org.apache.derby.tools.ij ij> connect 'NSSimpleDB'; Clients can continue to connect: Press [Enter] to stop Server

seg-source.mrk: Starting Network Server Testing if Network Server is up and running! <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server now running Got an embedded connection.

Testing embedded connection by executing a sample query number of rows in sys.systables = 16 While my app is busy with embedded work, ij might connect like this: $ java -Dij.user=me -Dij.password=pw -Dij.protocol= jdbc:derby:\\localhost:1527\ org.apache.derby.tools.ij ij> connect 'NSSimpleDB'; Clients can continue to connect: Press [Enter] to stop Server

target.mrk: Starting Network Server Testing if Network Server is up and running! <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server now running Got an embedded connection.

Testing embedded connection by executing a sample query number of rows in sys.systables = 16 While my app is busy with embedded work, ij might connect like this: $ java -Dij.user=me -Dij.password=pw -Dij.protocol= jdbc:derby:\\localhost:1527\ org.apache.derby.tools.ij ij> connect 'NSSimpleDB'; Clients can continue to connect: Press [Enter] to stop Server
